I would like to modify my Heritrix 3 configuration to perform an open-ended
crawl. From reading through the documentation I know this is possible, but
wanted to run the configuration by the experts to see if there were any
other things I need to think about here.

Here are the crawl rules in plain english:

1.) Candidate sites must end in .com, .net, .org, .edu, .gov
2.) Only crawl 12 items per domain (dns + robots.txt + 10 HTML pages)
3.) Ignore css, javascript, image, etc (really only interested in HTML as
much as possible)
4.) When a new domain is discovered, start the crawl for that site at the
root. For instance if I see a link in a page to
http://www.somedomain.com/a/b/c.html I want a new seed added for
www.somedomain.com

1 can be accomplished by pointing the SurtPrefixedDecideRule to a file with
the SURTs for the desired TLDs with an ACCEPT (in conjunction with the
default behavior of having the scope chain start with a REJECT all rule).

2 is accomplished by wiring a QuotaEnforcer into the fetch chain

3 is accomplished by a MatchesListRegexDecideRule (js, css, ico)
and MatchesFilePatternDecideRule (REJECT with preset ALL) in the scope
chain.

4 I'm a little stumped on, and not sure if that's possible. Or maybe it's
not necessary. I'll do some experimenting but would appreciate any input on
how new seeds are handled during an "open-ended" crawl.

Finally, I have noticed some performance issues with BDB as the crawl
frontier grows large. Are there any suggestions for performance tuning BDB
or possibly using an alternative database solution on a separate machine for
better scalability?

Thanks,
-Zach

--20cf30549a7d8485b804965ee7b3
